resources.string: You can retain You can retain X Accurate results as normal successful before rolling dice.
You can re-roll one attack die.

The target you select for a shoot action becomes the Primary target, and every other operative within X Blast distance and visible to the Primary Target becomes the Secondary targets (Regardless of their order). Resolve the shoot action for the Primary target, then roll another shoot action for every Secondary Target (You have to roll dice for every valid target) if the Primary target was Obscure and/or in cover, the Secondary targets will have those modifiers as well.
Your opponent can only parry with critical successes.
You can re-roll all attack dice showing the same result(Ex: all dice with a result of 2)
This weapon can be used once while Concealed without changing order.

Critical hits inflict immediate damage equal to the Devastating value, the dice are not discarded. If theres Range associate with the keyword, inflict that damage each other operative in that distance.

An operative cannot use this weapon if it moved during its activation, and it cannot move after performing a Shoot action with this weapon.
If marked Heavy (Reposition), Reposition is the only movement action allowed that still permits shooting in the same activation.
An operative cannot use Guard with a Heavy weapon if these conditions are not met.

After an operative shoots with this weapon, roll one D6, if the result is equal or greater than the Hit stat nothing happens, if the roll is less than the Hit stat, duplicate the value and deal that amount of damage to the friendly operative who made the shoot action.
If you hit multiple targets, Ex: Blast. Still roll only one D6.
Your successes equal or greater to Lethal x value are Critical successes.
After an operative uses this weapon x number of times, it cannot use this weapon again, if it hits multiple targets, Ex: Blast/Torrent. still treat it as only one use.

Whenever an Operative Shoot another Operative while this is Obscure, all Critical successes will become Normal successes, any rule around Critical success is ignored (Ex: Devastating, Piercing Crits, Punishing).
This action or weapon is a psychic attack.
The defender picks one less dice based on the Piercing X value.
The defender picks one less dice based on the Piercing Crits X value, if you score a Critical success.
If you retain any critical successes, you can change one failed dice into one success normal attack.
Only operatives within X inches can be targeted.
You can re-roll all attack dice.
Convert one normal hit into a critical when retaining a critical.
The defender cannot retain cover saves.
For the purpose of selecting a valid target for a shoot action, you can select operatives in Conceal if they are being cover by light terrain. This does not prevent Cover Saves if any.
For the purpose of selecting a valid target for a shoot action, you can select operatives in Conceal. This does not prevent any Cover Saves if any.

If you do not make any Critical success, you can change one Normal success into a Critical success, any rule such as Devastating or Piercing Crits X is applied accordingly, but it cannot be combine in any way with the rules Punishing or Rending, Ex: You cant just have 2 free Crits lmao.
The first time you strike with a Critical success, discard one of your opponents unresolved Normal success, if the opponent has no more Normal Successes, discard one of its Critical successes if any.
This weapon can be used while having a Conceal order.
If you retain any Critical success with this weapon, the enemy operative loses 1 Apl until the start of its next activation.

Select one valid target, this will be the Primary target, then select any number of secondary targets if they are valid as well and, if they are within Torrent X value range of the Primary objective. You cant select enemy targets in Control range of a friendly operative. Shoot this weapon against all of them, roll separately for each.
